Record Class ErrorMessage

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
edu.westminsteru.jasm.ErrorMessage
Record Components:
message - a message describing the error
sourceLine - the source line that has the error
lineNumber - the line number at which the error occurred, or UNSPECIFIC if it did occur on a particular line (the first line is line 1)
columnNumber - the column number within the line at which the error occurred, or UNSPECIFIC if it did not occur at a particular column (the first column is column 1)
public record ErrorMessage(String message, String sourceLine, int lineNumber, int columnNumber) extends Record
An error that occurred while assembling Jasm code

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    UNSPECIFIC
    Sentinel value for line or column signifying that the error doesn't pertain to a specific line or column number

  • Field Details

    • UNSPECIFIC

      public static final int UNSPECIFIC
      Sentinel value for line or column signifying that the error doesn't pertain to a specific line or column number
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • ErrorMessage

      public ErrorMessage(String message, String sourceLine, int lineNumber, int columnNumber)
      Creates a new ErrorMessage.
      Parameters:
      message - a description of the error
      sourceLine - the text of the line containing the error, or null if the error does not occur on a specific line
      lineNumber - the number of the line containing the error, counted from 1, or UNSPECIFIC if the error does not occur on a specific line
      columnNumber - the number of the column within the line containing the error, counted from 1, or UNSPECIFIC if the error does not occur at a specific column

    • ErrorMessage

      public ErrorMessage(String message)
      Creates a new ErrorMessage with no source line and UNSPECIFIC line and column numbers.
      Parameters:
      message - a description of the error

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. Reference components are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object); primitive components are compared with the compare method from their corresponding wrapper classes.
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
